title: How to mount a device “invisibly” in Linux (Linux, mount, Unix) - Quora

response.answer_text: How do you mount a device “invisibly” in Linux (Linux, mount, Unix)? First, you will have to explain what you mean by “mount a device invisibly”. Mounts are not “invisible” so that the administrator has the ability to identify filesystems that are reaching their limits (number of files, amount of free space, access controls, quotas…)
Maybe prefix the directory with a . (ie /.hidden)? It won’t evade file system listing etc, but would be hidden from a ‘casual user’.
